materials: Aluminum Cans; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes:
This site is located on Sabin Street, at the Medical University of South Carolina.  Money earned through the recycling program pays for non-medical items essential to the recovery of pediatric burn patients at the Children Hospital at Medical University of South Carolina (MUSC). 
 
 
ACBC funds also have been used to build and maintain 9 mobile Fire Safety Houses for fire and burn prevention education across the state. South Carolina launched this program in 1986 and it has been growing ever since!

name: Batteries Plus
materials: Compact Fluorescent Lights; Batteries (Rechargeable); Alkaline/Single-Use Batteries; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes:
Some fees for battery recycling may apply. Please contact your Local store for details.

Batteries Plus lead by example by recycling the majority of the batteries we sell. Not only do we recycle to protect our environment, we support retail and business customers alike by keeping them in full compliance with federal, state, municipal, EPA and DOT regulations governing the disposal and recycling of spent batteries and select electronics.
